text: The 2015–16 Indiana Pacers season was Indiana's 49th season as a franchise and 40th season in the NBA. With a healthy Paul George returning to form, the Pacers clinched a playoff spot after defeating the Brooklyn Nets on April 10. The victory eliminated the Chicago Bulls from playoff contention. The Pacers finished the regular season with a record of 45–37, which would earn them the seventh seed in the East. They would be matched up against the second seeded Toronto Raptors in the first round but in the end would be eliminated in a decisive seven-game series. ==2015 NBA draft== {| class="wikitable sortable sortable" ! style="background:#092c57; color:#ffc322" width=" 75px"| Round ! style="background:#092c57; color:#ffc322" width=" 75px"| Pick ! style="background:#092c57; color:#ffc322" width="175px"| Player ! style="background:#092c57; color:#ffc322" width="125px"| Position ! style="background:#092c57; color:#ffc322" width="150px"| Nationality ! style="background:#092c57; color:#ffc322" width="200px"| School/club team |- |align=center| 1 |align=center| 11 | Myles Turner |align=center| Center | | Texas |- |align=center| 2 |align=center| 43 | Joe Young |align=center| Point guard | | Oregon |- |} ==Roster== ==Standing== ==Game log== ===Preseason=== |- style="background:#fbb;" | 1 | October 3 | New Orleans | 105–110 | Paul George (18) | Lavoy Allen (8) | Robinson III, Stuckey (4) | Bankers Life Fieldhouse 13,725 | 0–1 |- style="background:#bfb;" | 2 | October 6 | @ Detroit | 115–112 | Paul George (32) | Shayne Whittington (8) | George Hill (8) | The Palace of Auburn Hills 10,446 | 1–1 |- style="background:#bfb;" | 3 | October 9 | Orlando | 97–92 | Miles, Robinson (14) | Ian Mahinmi (9) | Monta Ellis (7) | Amway Center 13,475 | 2–1 |- style="background:#bfb;" | 4 | October 13 | Detroit | 101–97 | Toney Douglas (15) | Lavoy Allen (6) | Toney Douglas (3) | Bankers Life Fieldhouse 12,730 | 3–1 |- style="background:#bfb;" | 5 | October 15 | @ Cleveland | 107–85 | Paul George (17) | Paul George (8) | Joe Young (6) | Quicken Loans Arena 18,774 | 4–1 |- style="background:#fbb;" | 6 | October 20 | @ Chicago | 94–103 | Paul George (26) | Paul George (13) | Ellis, Hill, Stuckey (3) | United Center 21,512 | 4–2 |- style="background:#bfb;" | 7 | October 22 | Charlotte | 98–86 | C.
